formattedAddress: 2741 Frederick Douglass Blvd, New York, NY 10039, USA
adrFormatAddress: 2741 Frederick Douglass Blvd, New York, NY 10039-3028, USA

originalText.text: This establishment is much more than a 'bodega'. They have a full range of breakfast, lunch and dinner options that change each day of the week. The wraps and salads are excellent and the hot food selections are the home made kind of delicious. One of my faves are the Turkey Wings (2/$4). I grab those and make rice and veggies to go with them when I want a healthy yet speedy prep meal. The staff is friendly, patient and professional. There is a wide variety of beverages including beer. And all food options can be accommodated from vegetarian to diabetic and other dietary needs.

originalText.text: I've been going to this deli for years. The food is great!! Their seafood soup is one of the best in the city. Tony the deli man is the best. The place recently was upgraded so it looks very nice they even have rotisserie chicken now. I highly recommend the deli

originalText.text: Do Not Come Here They Have Critical Deficiencies. I Came On Easter With My Friends. We Ordered Beef Stew With Rice & Beans @ 5pm Then Later That Night Around 9pm Our Stomach Was Upset For 2 Days Now. I Paid Cash & Tip The Cook $3. Im Reporting Y'all To The Better Business Bureau. The Have Bad Food Look Up On Department Of Health Page They Was Shut Down For 4 Months Because They Had Mold & Mildew.

originalText.text: always smelled the food from walking by. finally went in and got wat i usually get from most spanish places. pernil.  and i ate at alot of spanish restaurants in nyc. mainly bronx and manhatten. NOT GONNA LIE THIS HANDS DOWN IS THE BEST PERNIL IVE EVER TASTED. 11$A LB AND I GOT $6 WORTH. NEXT TIME IL GET THE POUND

originalText.text: The rice and red beaaaannnnssss!!!!!!!!!!! Ugh!!!!!!!! Please don't sleep on their turkey wings! The food is so good, lunch time the line is long. Its best to order ahead. This is definitely a hidden gem.
